QuestionStem: Which of the following correctly describes how water interacts with Earth's land? Select all that apply.

options.AnswerText: A. Water moves in the oceans as part of surface and deep currents.
B. Water moves below the ground as a result of aquifers and infiltration.
C. Water moves above the ground as a result of streams and runoff.
D. Water moves as wind blows clouds through the sky.
E. Water moves as runoff from clouds to the ground.

CorrectFeedback: Water interacts with land as surface water in runoff as streams and rivers. It also interacts with land through infiltration and groundwater.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Think about which of these processes involves water moving on or below Earth's land surfaces.
IncorrectFeedback: Think about which of these processes involves water moving on or below Earth's land surfaces.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: Water interacts with land as surface water in runoff as streams and rivers. It also interacts with land through infiltration and groundwater.
